Class SimpleBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.logic.SimpleBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class SimpleBoard extends Object implements Board
This class represents the game board.

This class handles the core game logic including:

  • Managing the game matrix
  • The movement events
  • Updating the game data
  • Creating view data for the GUI

  • Constructor Details

    • SimpleBoard

      public SimpleBoard(int width, int height)
      Constructs a SimpleBoard with the specified width and height.

      This method creates a board using the specified width and height, sets the current brick data and binds the label.

      Parameters:
      width - the width of the game board (number of columns)
      height - the height of the game board (number of rows)

  • Method Details

    • moveBrickDown

      public boolean moveBrickDown()
      Move the current brick down by one row.

      Check if the brick can be moved using MatrixOperations. If there is no collision, brick's position will increases along the y-axis by 1. Else the position stays the same.

      Specified by:
      moveBrickDown in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the brick moves, false if it collides

    • moveGhostPiece

      public void moveGhostPiece()
      Returns the brick's falling position.

      The ghost piece's position will continuously shift downwards until the brick cannot be moved through checking with MatrixOperations.

      Specified by:
      moveGhostPiece in interface Board

    • moveBrickLeft

      public boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Move the current brick left by one row.

      Check if the brick can be moved using MatrixOperations. If there is no collision, the brick's position will decrease along the x-axis by 1. Else the position stays the same.

      Specified by:
      moveBrickLeft in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the brick moves, false if it collides

    • moveBrickRight

      public boolean moveBrickRight()
      Move the current brick right by one row.

      Check if the brick can be moved using MatrixOperations. If there is no collision, the brick's position will increase along the x-axis by 1. Else the position stays the same.

      Specified by:
      moveBrickRight in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the brick moves, false if it collides

    • rotateLeftBrick

      public boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Rotate the brick counter-clockwise

      Get the rotated shape with BrickRotator. Check if the brick can be moved using MatrixOperations. If there is no collision, the brick will be rotated; Else the shape stays the same.

      Specified by:
      rotateLeftBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the brick moves, false if it collides

    • holdBrick

      public boolean holdBrick()
      Allows player to hold the brick.

      The method checks if the brick can be held or swapped using MatrixOperations and BrickGenerator. If no brick is currently held, the active brick will be held, but a new brick is created. Otherwise, the held brick is swapped with the current brick if possible.

      Specified by:
      holdBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if holding or swapping was successful, false if blocked

    • createNewBrick

      public boolean createNewBrick(int x, int y)
      Creates a new brick at the specified coordinates.

      The brick is generated using BrickGenerator and set to the BrickRotator

      Specified by:
      createNewBrick in interface Board
      Parameters:
      x - the column of the board matrix
      y - the row of the board matrix
      Returns:
      true if the new brick collides, false otherwise

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      Merges the current brick into the game matrix using MatrixOperations
      Specified by:
      mergeBrickToBackground in interface Board

    • clearRows

      public ClearRow clearRows()
      Clears filled rows from the board using MatrixOperations and returns ClearRow which contains information about the cleared rows and the new matrix.
      Specified by:
      clearRows in interface Board
      Returns:
      the result of the row clearing operation
